trans-unit.source: Configure a custom domain name in Azure App Service (GoDaddy)
trans-unit.target: Configure a custom domain name in Azure App Service (GoDaddy)

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use a domain name from GoDaddy with Azure Web Apps
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use a domain name from GoDaddy with Azure Web Apps

trans-unit.source: Configure a custom domain name in Azure App Service (Purchased directly from GoDaddy)
trans-unit.target: Configure a custom domain name in Azure App Service (Purchased directly from GoDaddy)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you have purchased domain through Azure App Service Web Apps then refer to the final step of Buy Domain for Web Apps article.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you have purchased domain through Azure App Service Web Apps then refer to the final step of Buy Domain for Web Apps article.

trans-unit.source: This article provides instructions on using a custom domain name that was purchased directly from [GoDaddy](https://godaddy.com) with [App Service Web Apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714).
trans-unit.target: This article provides instructions on using a custom domain name that was purchased directly from [GoDaddy](https://godaddy.com) with [App Service Web Apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714).

trans-unit.source: Understanding DNS records
trans-unit.target: Understanding DNS records

trans-unit.source: Add a DNS record for your custom domain
trans-unit.target: Add a DNS record for your custom domain

trans-unit.source: To associate your custom domain with a web app in App Service, you must add a new entry in the DNS table for your custom domain by using tools provided by GoDaddy.
trans-unit.target: To associate your custom domain with a web app in App Service, you must add a new entry in the DNS table for your custom domain by using tools provided by GoDaddy.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to locate the DNS tools for GoDaddy.com
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to locate the DNS tools for GoDaddy.com

trans-unit.source: Log on to your account with GoDaddy.com, and select **My Account** and then **Manage my domains**.
trans-unit.target: Log on to your account with GoDaddy.com, and select **My Account** and then **Manage my domains**.

trans-unit.source: Finally, select the drop-down menu for the domain name that you wish to use with your Azure web app and select **Manage DNS**.
trans-unit.target: Finally, select the drop-down menu for the domain name that you wish to use with your Azure web app and select **Manage DNS**.

trans-unit.source: custom domain page for GoDaddy
trans-unit.target: custom domain page for GoDaddy

trans-unit.source: From the **Domain details** page, scroll to the **DNS Zone File** tab.
trans-unit.target: From the **Domain details** page, scroll to the **DNS Zone File** tab.

trans-unit.source: This is the section used for adding and modifying DNS records for your domain name.
trans-unit.target: This is the section used for adding and modifying DNS records for your domain name.

trans-unit.source: DNS Zone File tab
trans-unit.target: DNS Zone File tab

trans-unit.source: Select **Add Record** to add an existing record.
trans-unit.target: Select **Add Record** to add an existing record.

trans-unit.source: To **edit** an existing record, select the pen & paper icon beside the record.
trans-unit.target: To **edit** an existing record, select the pen & paper icon beside the record.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Before adding new records, note that GoDaddy has already created DNS records for popular sub-domains (called **Host** in editor,) such as **email**, **files**, **mail**, and others.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Before adding new records, note that GoDaddy has already created DNS records for popular sub-domains (called **Host** in editor,) such as **email**, **files**, **mail**, and others.

trans-unit.source: If the name you wish to use already exists, modify the existing record instead of creating a new one.
trans-unit.target: If the name you wish to use already exists, modify the existing record instead of creating a new one.

trans-unit.source: When adding a record, you must first select the record type.
trans-unit.target: When adding a record, you must first select the record type.

trans-unit.source: select record type
trans-unit.target: select record type

trans-unit.source: Next, you must provide the **Host** (the custom domain or sub-domain) and what it **Points to**.
trans-unit.target: Next, you must provide the **Host** (the custom domain or sub-domain) and what it **Points to**.

trans-unit.source: add zone record
trans-unit.target: add zone record

trans-unit.source: When adding an **A (host) record** - you must set the **Host** field to either **@** (this represents root domain name, such as **contoso.com**,) * (a wildcard for matching multiple sub-domains,) or the sub-domain you wish to use (for example, **www**.) You must set the **Points to** field to the IP address of your Azure web app.
trans-unit.target: When adding an **A (host) record** - you must set the **Host** field to either **@** (this represents root domain name, such as **contoso.com**,) * (a wildcard for matching multiple sub-domains,) or the sub-domain you wish to use (for example, **www**.) You must set the **Points to** field to the IP address of your Azure web app.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When using A (host) records, you must also add a CNAME record with the following configuration:
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When using A (host) records, you must also add a CNAME record with the following configuration:

trans-unit.source: A **Host** value of **awverify** that **Points to** a value of **awverify.<yourwebappname>.azurewebsites.net**.
trans-unit.target: A **Host** value of **awverify** that **Points to** a value of **awverify.<yourwebappname>.azurewebsites.net**.

trans-unit.source: This CNAME record is used by Azure to validate that you own the domain described by the A record
trans-unit.target: This CNAME record is used by Azure to validate that you own the domain described by the A record

trans-unit.source: When adding a **CNAME (alias) record** - you must set the **Host** field to the sub-domain you wish to use.
trans-unit.target: When adding a **CNAME (alias) record** - you must set the **Host** field to the sub-domain you wish to use.

trans-unit.source: For example, **www**.
trans-unit.target: For example, **www**.

trans-unit.source: You must set the **Points to** field to the **.azurewebsites.net** domain name of your Azure web app.
trans-unit.target: You must set the **Points to** field to the **.azurewebsites.net** domain name of your Azure web app.

trans-unit.source: For example, **contoso.azurwebsites.net**.
trans-unit.target: For example, **contoso.azurwebsites.net**.

trans-unit.source: When you have finished adding or modifying records, click **Finish** to save changes.
trans-unit.target: When you have finished adding or modifying records, click **Finish** to save changes.

trans-unit.source: Enable the domain name on your web app
trans-unit.target: Enable the domain name on your web app

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: What's changed
trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
